frame.name: Political_locales
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame covers words that name Locations as defined politically, or administratively.
<ex><fex name="Name">Berkeley</fex> is a <fex name="Descriptor">wonderful</fex> <fex name="Locale"><t>city</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Constituent_parts
FE.definition: <def-root>The materials or <fen>Constituent_parts</fen> that make up a <fen>Locale</fen>. <ex>New York is a <t>city</t> <fex name="Constp">of glass and steel</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Container_possessor
FE.definition: <def-root>The location that the <fen>Locale</fen> is a part of. <ex>John spent several years wandering the <t>villages</t> <fex name="ContP">of Romania</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Locale
FE.definition:
<def-root>A stable bounded area. It is typically the designation of the nouns of Locale-derived frames.
<ex>There used to be a forest in that <fex name="Lcl"><t>city</t></fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>ULTIMATELY TO BE REPLACED BY MULTIWORD TARGETS (in almost all cases). This FE is used for the Names of Locales.
<ex>The <t>city</t> <fex name="Name">of Paris</fex></ex> <ex>The <t>town</t> <fex name="Name">of Smithersville</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition:
<def-root>A place that a Locale is located with respect to.
<ex>All the <t>cities</t> <fex name="RelLoc">near the San Francisco bay</fex> are large.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description, characteristic, or property of the <fen>Locale</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs.
<ex>He ruled the <fex name="des">largest</fex> <t>kingdom</t> <fex name="des">that ever existed</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Population
FE.definition:
<def-root>The people living in the jurisdiction of the locale.
<ex>Stawiski was a <t>city</t> <fex name="pop">of laborers</fex>, of whom can be said ?You shall eat your bread by the sweat of your brow? </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: barony.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the rank and estates of a baron.

lexUnit.name: territory.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area under the jurisdiction of a ruler or state.

lexUnit.name: country.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.

lexUnit.name: province.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a principal administrative division of a country or empire.

lexUnit.name: duchy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the territory of a duke or duchess.

lexUnit.name: viscountcy.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the jurisdiction of a viscount

lexUnit.name: county.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a political and administrative division of a state.

lexUnit.name: state [sovereign].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a nation or territory considered as an organized political community under one government.

lexUnit.name: principality.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a state ruled by a prince.

lexUnit.name: borough.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a town (as distinct from a city) with a corporation and privileges granted by a royal charter.

lexUnit.name: town.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a built-up area with a name, defined boundaries, and local government, that is larger than a village and generally smaller than a city.

lexUnit.name: realm.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a kingdom.

lexUnit.name: kingdom.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a country, state, or territory ruled by a king or queen.

lexUnit.name: municipality.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a town or district that has local government.

lexUnit.name: metropolis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the capital city of a country, or a large and busy city.

lexUnit.name: megalopolis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a very large, heavily populated city or urban complex

lexUnit.name: city.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a municipal centre incorporated by the state or province, or a town created a city by charter and containing a cathedral.

lexUnit.name: world.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the earth with all its countries and peoples

lexUnit.name: federal.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having or relating to a system of government in which several states form a unity but remain independent in internal affairs

lexUnit.name: global.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of or relating to the whole world; worldwide.

lexUnit.name: parish.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (in the Christian Church) a small administrative district with its own church and clergy. as modifier

lexUnit.name: diocese.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a district under the pastoral care of a bishop in the Christian Church.

lexUnit.name: international.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: pertaining to multiple nations.

lexUnit.name: local.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: relating or restricted to a particular area or one's neighbourhood.

lexUnit.name: locality.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an area or neighbourhood.

lexUnit.name: municipal.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of or relating to a municipality.

lexUnit.name: national.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: owned, controlled, or financially supported by the federal government

lexUnit.name: empire.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an extensive group of states ruled over by a single monarch, an oligarchy, or a sovereign state

lexUnit.name: village.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small municipality with limited corporate powers.

lexUnit.name: nation.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large aggregate of people united by common descent, culture, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory.

lexUnit.name: commonwealth.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an independent state or community, especially a democratic republic.

lexUnit.name: internationally.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: in multiple nations.

lexUnit.name: multinational.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: including or involving several countries or nationalities.

lexUnit.name: city-state.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a city and surrounding territory that forms an independent state.

lexUnit.name: district.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a region of a city marked off by the local government to designate its special representation or administrative status.

lexUnit.name: fiefdom.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a portion of land granted to an allegiant person by a lord in the system of feudalism

lexUnit.name: jurisdiction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the area in which a given political entity has power

lexUnit.name: land.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: territory controlled by a government

lexUnit.name: state [internal].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an organized political community or area forming part of a federal republic.

lexUnit.name: provincial.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: pertaining to a province.

lexUnit.name: territorial.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: of or relating to a political territory.

lexUnit.name: township.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a region of a county with varying degrees of autonomy, depending on which state it belongs to
